context: The Sargasso Sea has been around for centuries. It covers a vast area of the North Atlantic east of the Caribbean. It's just shifted a bit. However, this does provide some employment opportunities. As far as desalinated water for the power plant so the rich folks have air conditioning goes, I'm not too upset.

mother nature doing it's thing..... cleaning itself, feeding itself....being itself

with more 'bunker fish' there needs to be more food for them and places for them to hide and breed.....it inconveniences 'man' so we complain and look for things that caused it or for things to get rid of it

this could well be a sign of regrowth, or a reward from mother nature for the work done to keep shorelines cleaner

so what if it is because of climate change; that's been going on for billions of years

I defy any of you to disprove a connection of this to anthropogenic global warming.
We know AWG is real, so tell us this is nothing but a "cyclical" thing, though we've never seen it in human history.

context: If it looks like sewage it is sewage. Forger about climate change. Rolaw sewage has been dumped into our oceans from everywhere on earth. India, China, Mexico, Not to mention the poorest of countries

My guess - lots of untreated water from Sewage plants. It acts like fertilizer and the plants go nuts. Eventually the sea weed becomes disconnected and starts to float where the wind and waves pile it up on the shore. BILLIONS of flies show up and feed on it. They bite people too.
Saw this first hand at Cocoa Beach. Couldn't even fish from the shore as there was so much of this stuff.
You can't control the Sun people!!!
Why was this not harvested by China? Communists love a salty snack!
